main event: Two pilots at Barter Island, Alaska observed an unidentified aerial object on February 8, 1953.
interesting points: The object appeared to be circular in shape and emitted a very bright, white-hot light.
The object hovered for about 5 minutes, then moved rapidly over the aircraft the pilots were working on.
The object then moved to a position directly over the aircraft's tail before rapidly climbing to an altitude of about 10,000-12,000 feet.
The object made a pulsing or fluttering motion as it climbed, and blinked at regular intervals.
The object made a deep, heavy sound similar to large motors operating.
